Acked-by: Ahmad Fatoum <a.fatoum@pengutronix.de>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250707055331.2355809-2-gwenj@trabucayre.com
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Ahmad Fatoum
message:
ARM: mmu: panic when alloc_pte fails

We don't check the return value of alloc_pte for ARM32 PBL, but we do on ARM64
PBL as well as in barebox proper.

Let's unify behavior by panicing in alloc_pte right away if we run out of
memory.

Signed-off-by: Ahmad Fatoum <a.fatoum@pengutronix.de>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250806123714.2092620-5-a.fatoum@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Ahmad Fatoum
message:
ARM: mmu64: fix benign off-by-one in flush_cacheable_pages

For v8_flush_dcache_range(), the second argument is exclusive, but we
are passing flush_end potentially, which is ~0ULL.

This is not a real problem, because the virtual address space can't be
64-bit anyway, but in preparation for compiling the code for 32-bit as
well, let's fix the off-by-one.

Signed-off-by: Ahmad Fatoum <a.fatoum@pengutronix.de>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250806123714.2092620-14-a.fatoum@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Ahmad Fatoum
message:
tee: optee: skip optee node fixup if method is NULL

The function fixes up an OP-TEE node as well as reserved memory regions.
It can be useful to fix up the memory reservations, but not the OP-TEE
node itself, so let's make this possible if the method is NULL.

Signed-off-by: Ahmad Fatoum <a.fatoum@barebox.org>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250806125229.2804284-2-a.fatoum@barebox.org
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Stefan Kerkmann
message:
net: usb: r8152: disable rx aggregation

Enabling RX aggregation packs multiple ethernet frames into one usb bulk
transfer. This increases the throughput significantly, but the driver
currently has no logic in `r8152_rx_fixup` to split the received frames.
This causes silently dropped packets. As the expected througput in a
bootloader using a USB ethernet adapter is rather low this "workaround"
is fine for now.

Signed-off-by: Stefan Kerkmann <s.kerkmann@pengutronix.de>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250807-fix-rtl8152-dropped-packages-v1-1-a71d05b4d166@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Ahmad Fatoum
message:
ARM64: configs: multi_v8: disable layerscape temporarily

With multi_v8, we build everything in a single build and that makes the
layerscape PBLs exceed their hard limit of 64K failing the build.

Until resolved, let's disable it from the defconfig. Users can still use
the dedicated layerscape defconfigs.

Signed-off-by: Ahmad Fatoum <a.fatoum@barebox.org>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250730055743.922932-2-a.fatoum@barebox.org
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Tobias Waldekranz
message:
efi: fix probing of EFI devices with parents

The refactor in the referenced commit sends in the match function as
the context data - instead of the handle we are looking for.

This meant that efi_find_device() always returned NULL, leading to all
EFI devices with parent handles not being probed.

Fix this by sending in the handle instead.

Fixes: 4a5a9b58b568 ("drive: bus: make use of new bus_find_device helper")
Signed-off-by: Tobias Waldekranz <tobias@waldekranz.com>
Tested-by: Ahmad Fatoum <a.fatoum@pengutronix.de>
Reviewed-by: Ahmad Fatoum <a.fatoum@pengutronix.de>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250813214103.254178-1-tobias@waldekranz.com
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Marco Felsch
message:
nvmem: core: allow single and dynamic device ids

At the moment only DEVICE_ID_DYNAMIC is supported. Add support for
NVMEM_DEVID_NONE to allow static device names via of-aliases and to
align our core with Linux.

While on it fix the nvmem_register_cdev() by using the dev_name() which
honors the DEVICE_ID_* cases else we end up with different names for the
devfs and the device itself.

The dev_dbg() message can be dropped as well since the register_device()
can print this message too.

Signed-off-by: Marco Felsch <m.felsch@pengutronix.de>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250818-v2025-06-0-topic-nvmem-v2-7-b6d677f6c519@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Marco Felsch
message:
eeprom: at24: fix device name handling

The nvmem_core already handles the ids/numbering, there is no need for
the driver to do it too. Furthermore it's wrong because the final device
would be: eeprom00 instead of eeprom0.

While on it fix the alias name handlng too since the device is never
named as described by the alias, but 'alias<ID>'. Since the
nvmem_core supports NVMEM_DEVID_{NONE,AUTO}, pass this information to
the core so the name would be: 'alias'.

Also while on it, make devname a 'const char *' pointer since the name is
allocated later on by the dev_set_name() during the nvmem_register()
call.

Signed-off-by: Marco Felsch <m.felsch@pengutronix.de>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250818-v2025-06-0-topic-nvmem-v2-8-b6d677f6c519@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Michael Tretter
message:
ARM: rockchip: bootm: don't propagate error from register_image_handler

register_image_handler() always returns 0 and never fails.

Make this obvious by not propagating the return code from
register_image_handler() but always returning 0 in
rockchip_register_barebox_image_handler().

This is a preparation for adding more image handlers for Rockchip.

Signed-off-by: Michael Tretter <m.tretter@pengutronix.de>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250820-rkimage-signed-v1-3-0ad3d1d1c952@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Sascha Hauer
message:
kbuild: move PBL_CODE_SIZE_ out of rule_pblb

Before Commit 21613ae35f ("kbuild: images/Makefile: fix broken if_changed usage")
setting of PBL_CODE_SIZE_$*, PBL_MEMORY_SIZE_$* and PBL_IMAGE_SIZE_$*
were part of the

$(obj)/%.pblb: $(obj)/%.pbl FORCE

rule which was always executed due to the FORCE. Beginning with this
commit setting of these variables are part of rule_pblb which is only
executed when the pblb file is (re-)generated. In case the pblb is still
up to date this results in the variables being unset which then fails
in later stages.

Move setting of the variables back to the pblb rule to make sure they
are always set.

Reproducer:

make multi_v8_defconfig && make && make

The second make will fail while calling the imx-image tool which gets
the -p option without the actual size as optarg.

Fixes: 21613ae35f ("kbuild: images/Makefile: fix broken if_changed usage")
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250825131806.2050398-1-s.hauer@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Chali Anis
message:
efi: payload: early-mem: add memory type on early mem allocation

Add the ability to specify the memory type which mendatory for the
recent efi versions that have MMU, this will fix a permission fault
on second level when trying to relocate the barebox or even execting
the memory code. see the snapshot error log below.

 SP 0x000000007C6CFF80  ELR 0x000000006C6EA4FC  SPSR 0x60000205  FPSR 0x00000000
 ESR 0x8600000E          FAR 0x000000006C6EA4FC
 ESR : EC 0x21  IL 0x1  ISS 0x0000000E
 Instruction abort: Permission fault, second level

Fixes: c937ad266413 ("efi: return pointer from efi_earlymem_alloc")
Signed-off-by: Chali Anis <chalianis1@gmail.com>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250822053717.1050752-1-chalianis1@gmail.com
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Alexander Kurz
message:
ARM i.MX: fix iMX6SL detection

When booting iMX6SL SoC, a message "detected unknown i.MX6 revision 1.2"
has been reported. Fix thie detection for iMX6SL again.

fixes: 82239accfc8  ("ARM: i.MX6: factor out function to read si_rev")
Signed-off-by: Alexander Kurz <akurz@blala.de>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250827151435.16352-1-akurz@blala.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Chali Anis
message:
arm: crypto: add a check for crypto extensions support.

In some configuration the CPU may raise an exception bacause of an
unknown instruction if it does not support Crypto Extensions for
example in some BCM281X (RPi3B in my case) when running barebox
as an EFI Payload, where the EFI stops with a synchronous execption
See bellow:
Synchronous Exception at 0x0000000037BFF548
SP 0x0000000037F798C0 ELR 0x0000000037BFF548
SPSR 0x20000209 FPSR 0x00000000
ESR 0x02000000 FAR 0x14F64325185430BF
ESR : EC 0x00 IL 0x1 ISS 0x00000000

Signed-off-by: Chali Anis <chalianis1@gmail.com>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250827155307.764061-1-chalianis1@gmail.com
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Sascha Hauer
message:
ARM: mmu: fix <unknown> mapping print

Mask out the ARCH_MAP_FLAG_PAGEWISE bit in map_type_tostr(). Otherwise
mapping types with this bit set end up being <unknown>.

Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250829131142.415464-1-s.hauer@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Christian Thießen
message:
mtd: Make mtd_erase fail gracefully if CONFIG_MTD_WRITE is off

When CONFIG_MTD_WRITE is unset, the mtd->_erase member of partition
devices does not get initialized, so it remains NULL.
However when running ubiattach on an UBI partition, mtd_erase() still
gets called, tries to call mtd->_erase and crashes. Make it fail
gracefully by returning ENOSYS ("Function not implemented") instead.

Reviewed-by: Ahmad Fatoum <a.fatoum@pengutronix.de>
Signed-off-by: Christian Thießen <christian.thiessen@airbus.com>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250903-mtd-erase-enosys-v2-1-7b7f28302f25@airbus.com
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Chali Anis
message:
drivers: video: efi-gop: fix null reference pointer on priv->fb.mode=NULL.

fix a null reference pointer on mode variable, that was never initialized,
the mode will be set by the framebuffer subsyetem after initialisation so
it's not necessary to change the resolution here.

Fixes: 6518b21c6c66 ("video: add EFI Graphics Output Protocol support")

Signed-off-by: Chali Anis <chalianis1@gmail.com>
Reviewed-by: Ahmad Fatoum <a.fatoum@pengutronix.de>
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250828041419.1874774-1-chalianis1@gmail.com
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Sascha Hauer
message:
ARM: k3: am625: fix syscon-reboot-mode

On AM625 the DEVSTAT register for specifying the reboot mode is at
0x43000030, not at 0x43010030.

Fixes: 45647c1c85 ("ARM: k3: add syscon-reboot-mode")
Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250910115956.3195025-1-s.hauer@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Sascha Hauer
message:
hush: fix last_return_code when PROMPT_COMMAND is used

Wenn PROMPT_COMMAND is used then a "echo $?" shows the result of the
PROMPT_COMMAND instead of the result of the last command. Fix this by
restoring the previous value after PROMPT_COMMAND has been executed.

Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250917133624.2993647-1-s.hauer@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>

author: Sascha Hauer
message:
ARM: am62l: fix mdio clock id

Based on this commit found in the TI downstream repository:

| commit 20778f6c125dc24e62767dc4837d793a0f18c319
| Author: Siddharth Vadapalli <s-vadapalli@ti.com>
| Date:   Wed Jun 4 15:41:53 2025 +0530
|
|    PENDING: arm64: dts: ti: k3-am62l-main: Fix MDIO clock
|
|    Based on the Clock ID documentation for AM62L [0], the Clock ID for the
|    MDIO module within CPSW3G should be '9' instead of '13'. Hence, fix it.
|
|    [0]: https://github.com/TexasInstruments/arm-trusted-firmware/blob/ti-master/docs/plat/ti-am62l.rst#am62l-clock-scmi-id-list
|    Fixes: 12b7268608d8 ("PENDING: arm64: dts: ti: k3-am62l-main: Add CPSW3G DT node")
|    Signed-off-by: Siddharth Vadapalli <s-vadapalli@ti.com>

Link: https://lore.barebox.org/20250919102255.1928858-1-s.hauer@pengutronix.de
Signed-off-by: Sascha Hauer <s.hauer@pengutronix.de>
